definition: to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion
to bury
to blame
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate

sentences.english: In old society many talented young people were too often ploughed under.
sentences.chinese: 在旧社会许多有才干的青年常被埋没。

sentences.english: Faultfinding is one talent that ought to be buried.
sentences.chinese: 吹毛求疵是人们必须埋没的一个才干。

sentences.english: The mud-rock flow submerged the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 泥石流埋没了整个村庄。

sentences.english: Workers should avoid 'hiding themselves' at work, he says.
sentences.chinese: 加芬克尔称，员工应该避免“把自己埋没在”工作中。

sentences.english: This shirt I found in the store is a real diamond in the rough.
sentences.chinese: 我在店里找到的那件衬衫真是被埋没了的好货。

sentences.english: Huge rockslides at times bury bulldozers and other machines.
sentences.chinese: 有时候巨大岩石崩落埋没了压路机及其他机器。

sentences.english: The faster player was no longer rushing to bury their neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 速度较快的参与者也不再急于将邻居埋没。

sentences.english: Secretarial work is a waste of her talent.
sentences.chinese: 做秘书是在埋没她的才能。

sentences.english: History is a funny animal. People can get lost in the mists of time.
sentences.chinese: 历史是个有趣的活物，会将人物埋没于时间的迷雾中。

definition: to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
talent/CL:份[fen4]
mediocre/indifferent/commonplace
undiscovered talent (idiom)
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
to become forgotten/to forget
mediocrity
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
to bring up/to train/to contribute to/achievements (usually of young people)
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
